sense.name: plant
sense.commentary: a plant cultivated for it's blooms or blossoms
sense.examples: He grows flowers in the backyard. Flowers always make a nice gift. I took a class to learn to arrange flowers.

sense.name: bloom
sense.commentary: blossom - the reproductive organ of angiosperm plants especially one having showy or colorful parts
sense.examples: The flower of the plant is wilting. Those who eat dandelions say that the flower is tastier than the stem.

sense.name: prime
sense.commentary: FLOWER[+event] peak, heyday, bloom, blossom, efflorescence, flush - the period of greatest prosperity or productivity
sense.examples: It was the flower or the golden age of cinema.

sense.name: virginity
sense.commentary: FLOWER[+event] a euphemism for someone's virginity.
sense.examples: You can't have my flower. She was glad to have finally given him her flower.
